=== Notes ===

'''0) Access BIOS settings'''

Hit F12 when the Dell logo is displayed to access BIOS settings and change the boot order.

'''1) Potential issue with Mobile Intel QM57 Express chipset:'''

Effect(s): screen remains blank<<BR>>
Work around: See second potential issue below<<BR>>
Bug report(s): https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xserver-xorg-video-intel/+bug/557744

'''2) Potential issue with NVidia NVS 3100M videocard'''

Effect(s): screen remains blank<<BR>>
Work around: (copied from install report on HP EliteBook 8440p)<<BR>>
  1. after boot from installer media select the nomodeset option (F6)<<BR>>
  2. after installation, hit SHIFT during boot to get grub screen<<BR>>
  3. change 'quiet splash' to 'nosplash nomodeset' on line that starts with 'linux'<<BR>>
  4. crtl-x to continue booting<<BR>>
  5. after login, activate proprietary NVidia drivers (requires Internet access?)<<BR>>
  6. edit /etc/default/grub: change to GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT='nosplash nomodeset'<<BR>>
  7. sudo update-grub<<BR>>
Bug report(s): 
** https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/lucid/+source/xorg/+bug/561802
** https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xserver-xorg-video-nouveau/+bug/556872

'''3) No scrolling with Alps touchpad'''

Bug report(s): 
** https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/lucid/+source/xorg/+bug/558750 
** https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/550625
** https://patchwork.kernel.org/patch/99823/

'''4) Ricoh e822 card reader'''

Patch proposed in Bugzilla successfully applied to 2.6.32-24.39 kernel modules:
** https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=596475
** https://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=16390

'''5) Internal microphone'''

The internal microphone does not work after a default install. Append the line "options snd-hda-intel model=dell-s14" to file /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf, reboot and adjust the mixer levels. Thanks to lidex on UbuntuForums:
** http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=9448177
